revised_title: Kr I 3d Absorption Spectrum: Potential Barrier Minimum and Delayed Onset of Continuous Absorption
tldr: The authors studied the 3d absorption spectrum of Kr I and found a potential barrier minimum and delayed onset of continuous absorption beyond the 3d limit. They normalized their experimental curve to previous absolute cross-section measurements and compared it with Hartree-Fock and random phase approximation with exchange (rpa) calculations. The experimental maximum occurs at a lower energy than predicted by the theoretical models, indicating a systematic trend in photoionization from subshells with nodeless wavefunctions.
